Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ilea W
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 9 month old daughter visited Paris for the first time. We flew in from California.This hotel met and exceeded our expectations. The staff are beyond friendly. Louis Phillipe was so helpful, friendly and charming. Great breakfast, great location and close to metro stations. Rooms are small but this doesn't matter if you plan on only sleeping in the room and spending your days and evenings exploring Paris. We will definitely stay here next time we return.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, clean with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dempsey_Family08
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, and larger than expected. No bath is a small downside, but not a major problem. Tea and coffee facilities and a fridge are nice to have, and no longer assumed in hotels, so that was a positive. The location is not great, but very close to a metro station. It depends on whether you like to walk everywhere really? Phillipe on reception was very helpful with suggestions. Overall, a good hotel if you can get a well priced deal.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Rodder5
Reviews.Content: I took my fiancee to Paris for her 30th bday and just wanted somewhere close to a metro station so we could get in the sights! The hotel is modern, very clean and staff were very polite and helpful. Its only 10-15min walk to eiffel tower and the metro stop is just accross the road as well as the mainlane station about 100 yards up the road which you need if you are heading to Versailles. The room we had was fairly small, but clean and modern. But then we were out most of the day and evening so this wasnt a problem. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Birthday stay Feb-12”
Reviews.Author: Bristoltraveller86
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent for both of us, roughly 12 minute walk from the Eiffel tower. There is one major point for some travellers to note - if you are a very very light sleeper then the metro may pose a problem. We were in room 201 which faced the front of the hotel and had no problem getting off, the higher up the hotel you are the less likely you will hear the metro Having the metro so near is a boon if you are not a walker as you can get to anything instantly, we walked from the hotel - Eiffel tower - arc de triomphe - louvre - notre dame and back to the hotel one day Hotel rooms, staff and service were as you would expect for a 4 star. Kevin at reception was very helpful If you go out for food locally I would recommend oh! duo up the road at number 54 (roughly), great family run restaurant at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Small and cute”
Reviews.Author: Katemaria22
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in february for 4 nights. We arrived at 1 o clock in the morning and were absolutly shattered , the boy on reception was very nice even thow was quite annoyed that he wanted to charge us 165 euros per night, after telling him twice weve already paid, but as he apologised and mentioned it was his first day, we forgive him :) The room was quite spacious , was abit dissapoited that the only thing on tv we could watch was whitney houstons funeral!!! Room was cleaned and tidyed every day which was extra special, only thing missing the teas and sugars where never replenished so we had to keep going to the restaurant and asking for more. Other then those few things, the staff were excellent always smiling and willing to help. :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Nelly59CR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Mercure Plaza Pont Mirabeau for five nights in February and we have a lovely time. The reception staff were excellent throughout our stay, being consistently friendly and helpful and providing some valuable guidance as to local places to eat and drink (Oh! Duo being particularly excellent). The hotel is situated on a relatively (for Paris) quiet street, right outside the Javel Andre Citroen Metro station and a is couple of minutes walk from the Javel RER station, which can take you to the Eiffel Tower in five minutes (although it's only twenty minutes to walk) and Notre Damme in ten. Despite being part of a large hotel chain, the Plaza Pont Mirabeau is quite a small hotel and has quite a lot of the sort of small hotel charm that is often lacking in the larger hotels that you often find in big cities like Paris. We had a first floor room and, as has been commented on by other reviewers, we could hear the Metro trains when they passed, but the sound was not loud enough to be disturbing or intrusive and did not disturb our sleep at all. However, it may be something you wish to consider if you are a particularly light sleeper. Apart from that, our room was comfortable, clean and well presented. When we were checked in, we were told that we could move to another room if the one we'd been given was not to our satisfaction in any way. The hotel has a small restaurant area where they serve an excellent buffet breakfast each morning. Overall we had an excellent time staying at the Plaza Pont Mirabeau and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Alaverdyan
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary weekend in Paris and I've been very pleased I booked Mercure Pont Mirabeau! New hotel, typical modern Mercure. Rooms are big and spacious, very well furnished and styled. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Not much to say, a comfortable and nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: London_Hotspot
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here at the beginning of January and absolutely loved it! It is a new hotel and you can tell by the touches of style and decor, it has a modern finishing and the rooms are very clean. When we first arrived we requested a top floor room having read the reviews and wanted a river view. As there were none available we decided to take a room on the 1st floor but due to the metro noise we requested to be moved and the staff were very accommodating. Our room was lovely and very big in comparison to the first one they gave us, the bed was extremely comfortable and there were tea and coffee facilities (although there is no English breakfast tea so I would suggest taking some with you). Breakfast is slightly expensive but they had a good selection to choose from. Although the location of the hotel is only a 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower it is still quite far from Central Paris; on the plus side there is a very convenient metro and train station right opposite the hotel. There are also a number of restaurants along the street and a variety of cuisines to choose from including Thai, Indian, Lebanese and French. There is also a Supermarket and a Post Office down the road which has a cash point. All in all the service, hotel and location were terrific and suited our needs for the 2 nights we were there. The only downside is that there were no English television channels apart from BBC News and some of the rooms are very very small so my advice would be to ask for a more spacious room on arrival. I would also recommend sleeping on a top floor to avoid the sounds from the cars and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Its a typical Mercure-Standard hotel. With clean and quality Rooms. Maybe the rooms are smaller than one might expect, but I suppose all rooms in Paris are. The room I stayed on the 7th floor had a nice view of the Seine river, and if not for the tall building right in front, we would have had a great view of the Eiffel Tower as well. The hotel is exceptionally well accessible with RER C and Metro line 10 almost at the door step. One might not a lot of choices in restaurants in the neighborhood though.

Reviews.Title: “service!!”
Reviews.Author: lingamn
Reviews.Content: service :we arrived late (after a 15 hour delay).....at 10 pm.greeted by a very hospitable young chap ( good looking- we forgot to get his name). check in was easy.at 11 pm at nite, he got us a map , and wrote us places to visit, things to do and even helped us with metro stations. spoke very good english. rooms - small but well appointed.clean.we stayed at room 106 ( despite the reviews bout metro noise , we heard nothing) location - perfect.metro station at your doorstep. you could see the eiffel tower from the doorstep.all attractions a few metros away.since it was winter, we relied on the metros instead of walking. all in all - great stay, great location but best of all, service!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jade S
Reviews.Content: Great location for me. I stayed for 3 nights and could walk everywhere and the metro stop was just outside the front door. The hotel was lovely on the inside. Very modern and clean. I booked a single room and was given a double. The rooms was beautiful, the bathrooms very modern, the shower head lit up different colours (small things like this make me happy) and the layout of the room wonderful. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I booked this hotel through Accor during a sale and it was amazing value for money. There is also free wi-fi and a fridge available for use.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Chris483
Reviews.Content: I don't normally review any hotel I stay at but felt compelled to leave a positive review after my stay in this cosy and friendly hotel. The location, price, amazing bed and excellent staff make this a real gem of a place! Me and my partner stayed for 3 nights from 06-09 January and stayed on the standard double room in 205 on the second floor, and although a bit small, the decor was very tasteful. The shower was excellent but the main highlight was the ultra comfy bed, particularly after a long day trekking through the lourve. The location was great, only 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower, with the metro station and RER station right outside the hotel. We were able to get almost anywhere in Paris within two stops, and it was very easy to find from the airport. We didn't try the breakfast as it was a bit expensive, but the bistro on the corner and cake shop behind the hotel were amazing. There was one slight hiccup when we were checking out as their records showed we ordered a breakfast on our first day, but the ever helpful staff were quick to rectify. The staff were excellent throughout the stay and are a credit to whoever manages the hotel, they spoke great English and were on hand 24/7 to help us out. We will definitely be back and will recommend this hotel to all our friends looking to go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: Mwereska
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed for 3 nights and loved the hotel. We stayed on the standard double room which was very clean and decorated nicely. We were early for check in but were able to leave our bags and go sightseeing, the guy at the reception was very helpful and gave us a map, marking down places to visit. Perfect location only 10 minute walk from the Eiffel tower and the metro station is next to the hotel which is very handy. Breakfast was nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only problem we had was the hot water wasn't working but the receptionist did offer to send us to another hotel and pay for our taxi but because we were only there 3 nights there wasn't any point. I took down the email as the receptionist said we would receive 50% back which was a bonus, still waiting on an email back so hopefully it doesn't take too long. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: HoMous
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Paris with my partner, the hotel staff were polite, friendly and helpful. We were assigned to a very small ground floor room which had two small windows. -Very small room barely large enough for a double bed -Constant vibrations throughout the night from passing subway trains -2 windows with prison style bars covering them, with a dismal view looking directly at other rooms, through the hotel court yard. -Tea and coffee was only provided for one person despite two staying Some positive points to mention about the room -Well decorated -Very clean I notice that there are some very positive reviews about this hotel, my advice would be to ensure that you are staying in a good room in the hotel before you commit to purchasing in order to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but 3* feeling”
Reviews.Author: Windsurfer147
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 Nights at the Mercure Mirabeau and it has been a nice stay. Stayed in a quite small standard room but it was clean and well maintained. The location is very calm and well connected to the Center (metro + RER) so do not be afraid to stay there is you just need a place to sleep while you visit Paris. Breakfast was fine and staff helpful Overall you get what you pay for... for 100+ Euros it is a safe choice and you won't be ending in an old smelly place with a dirty bathroom. The hotel is rated 4* by the new French standards but don't expect anything fancy (slipper, bathrobe, filled minibar . It is more of a very good 3*

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but everything there”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: This was the smallest room we've stayed in all of Europe, yet everything is there. We used every square cm of this room:the petite floating bed side shelf, the desk & chair, every small surface around the sink, all the closest as there was only ONE luggage rack for our 2 bags. We had to ask for ice & they didn't remove 2nd bucket (nor clean our room for 2 days); we found out they only have 2 ice buckets in the entire hotel. So I told them for us to get more ice, they needed to retrieve the buckets from our unserviced room. On the (very) plus side, the air conditioning was great as it was an unusually VERY hot October-this not to be taken lightly as A/C is not a given especially often turned off in the fall. Everything is compact, the room, the reception area the very small bar/waiting area. It is nicely located right opposite the Metro and there is a Post Office/bank & Carre Four grocery store about a 5 minute walk down Emile Zola for getting sandwiches, cheese, bread & drinks 6 days a week. The area is quiet and not touristy which allowed us access to excellent neighborhood restaurants. There is a computer/printer in the "reception"/entry area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, metro 10 station is just in front of the hotel. The staff is friendly, speaks English, they even borrowed us wine glasses:) Hotel is very clean (with a daily room service) with a modern bathroom (and with very weird color-lighted shower...), though the room was REALLY small. However, we didn't mind, because we only used it for sleeping. By the way, the room had a small fridge and a balcony. The bed vas wery comfortable, it was the first time I woke up without a terrible pain in my back. So yes, we really enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Will Return!!”
Reviews.Author: michellef1
Reviews.Content: Great Location, just been refurbished so modern and clean, great view from the room over the window, very friendly staff and a large selection at breakfast! Couldn't ask for better! What makes this hotel great is that it is away from the hustle and bustle of the centre of town but you can take a leisurely walk along the river to the eiffel tower. Also the metro stop Javel is just outside the main entrance making it perfect for catching a train. We walked everywhere and was just a great weekend! We used the metro to get to Euro Disney and it couldn't have been any easier! Thankyou for making our stay so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic weekend in paris”
Reviews.Author: CBRY
Reviews.Content: hotel not in centre of paris but a great location just a 15 min walk from eiffel tower and a metro station literally 2 mins away on line 10. we booked this hotel on last minute.com on a top secret hotel deal but I def would pay a few pounds more for this hotel as it was so good. On arrival at the hotel it was pretty typical of a paris hotel - smart, clean and tiny reception. We arrived a few hrs early of check in and were going to leave our bags of but were quickly ushered to a room - which was upgraded from what we had booked!! Note staff were all fantastic - spoke perfect english - which was very helpful for us and so welcoming - merci!! The room we had was on floor 6. All areas of the hotel were spotless and we were very pleased!! Our room was beautiful - with lovely balcony views of the river. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed 4 nights of undisturbed sleep. The bathroom was in the style of a wetroom and the mood lighting in the shower was a nice touch. Our towels were replaced every day, as well as shampoo and showergel etc which was great. We slept in each morning so didnt have breakfast at hotel. We normally ended up with breakfast on the go. We usually went to a nearby monoprix which was great for drinks, fresh fruit and pastries etc = we found one by turning right out of hotel and walking 5 mins to Charles michel square. We made great use of metro during out stay- nearest line was line 10 so usually took 10-15 mins to get anywhere in city centre and we found 3 day pass was great value for money, All in all would highly recommend this hotel and will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: LPML1977
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent weekend in Paris and a lot of that was down to the hotel. Even before I arrived, Veronique helped plan out weekend. She arranged dinner on the seine, city tour and a trip to the moulin rouge (a must by the way!). I had read other reviews about some of the lower rooms hearing the subway so we upgraded for 40€ a night to room 703. The room was very nice. Not massive but had everything we needed. It was very clean and well presented (see photos). It had a balcony with a great view of the seine. I assume lower floors may not have the same view? The whole hotel was very well presented. We had breakfast in our room the second day and it was superb continental breakfast. We never made it down to the dining room for breakfast. As well as Veronique, all the staff were extremely helpful and polite. Sorted out taxis and other little requests without hesitation. The hotel is about 20 mins walk from the Eiffel tower. There you can pick up various tour buses to move you around. The metro is about 100 yards away although we meet used it. All in all, a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tomas1983
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Mercure Plaza Pont Mirabeau for 4 nights. This hotel is perfectly located just 15 min. on foot to Eiffel Tower, metro station just across the street. Rich selection of breakfast. All staff members at reception desk were very friendly and helpfull. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - rer, subway stations right next to the hotel, only 15min walk along the Seine to the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast OK compare to other hotels in Paris in this hotel category. Room rather small and even on the 7th floor a little bit of noise from subway trains going under the hotel or close to the hotel, so if you are light sleeper, better ask for room on the higher floor. Hotel staff always helpful. Overall we would stay in this hotel again next time.

Reviews.Title: “5* service at 3* prices, very good value for $/EUR spent”
Reviews.Author: RCKKMK
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 days in the hotel, and enjoyed it very much. Rooms are nice (not opulent, but more than comfortable) and very modern and clean. However, they are Paris-sized (not unlike NYC or SF or Tokyo) and you'll want to pay extra for the "privilege room" if you're going to be there a while. As mentioned, Métro line 10 is immediately across the street and the RER train is just across the bridge; there's also a bicycle rental station, and a Hertz outlet (in a gas station) a few doors down. Wifi -- pronounced wee-fee, of course :) -- is free for basic web/webmail use (you have to pay for streaming or VPN; my solution was not to check work e-mail :) The neighborhood is pretty quiet in the evenings, which can be good or bad depending on how you look at it. But there are plenty of shops (including a Carrefour City and a Monoprix) in easy walking distance, and an assortment of restaurants nearby. What really makes this place stand out is the customer service. Though there isn't a dedicated concierge, the desk staff were always friendly and willing to offer pointers. In particular, Kevin (chef de réception, we gather) was a particular delight -- not just in personality, but also in off-the-wall useful information. The desk staff and the maids were more than accommodating of requests (e.g. extra towels, an American thing :). Breakfast was also really good -- buffet style with croissants, pain-au-chocolat, baguettes, assorted cold cuts, etc. Our room rate included breakfast, which was a bargain; they'll also bring a tray to your room for 2 euros if you want to nibble in your jammies. Overall, the Mercure Mirabeau was an excellent tradeoff between value (much cheaper than center-city) and quality (rooms, service, etc.). Having travelled to Paris several times and many other cities around the world, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Choosing this hotel proved to be very inspired. The room was very clean, new furniture, modern and comfortable. Location is very good hotel, close to metro. Eifel Tower is about 2000 meters. I will return and definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and with lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute after reading good reviews and I wasn't disappointed at all. I'd read that the standard rooms were a little small, but it was fine and decorated to a high standard. It's Paris; how much time are you going to spend in your room anyway?! Although after our first nights sleep we struggled to get out of bed because it was ridiculously comfortable! Staff were friendly and helpful, and it's only a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. When I next go to Paris I'd happily stay here again. My only gripe was the lack of normal tea in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: royzer76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, just a short 15 minute walk along the River Seine to the Eiffel Tower. Very good transport links near by, 'Javel' Metro station is opposite the hotel and 'Javel' RER Train station is about a 2-3 minute walk from the hotel. A short walk from the hotel are a small range of shops, supermarkets and cafes if you dont fancy wandering far. If youre travelling into Gare du Nord, you can take the RER B Train to St Michel/Notre Dam and then connect to the RER C Train to Javel. Hotel is 2-3 minute walk from there. The hotel is an old building, but Mercure have recently moved in and done a makeover. Rooms appear to all vary in size and layout. Our first room was 601, not huge but comfortable with everything you need. Bathroom was probably the nicest room. 601 has a small balcony that you can step out on, with a view of the Seine. Unfortunately because the TV didn't work and the mini fridge would have made a better oven, the next day we had to move. We were moved to 301, a few floors directly under where we had been originally. Same sized room due to the layout of the building. This room had patio doors but sadly no balcony and only a view of trees and the street. So if you want a Seine view you need to be on the front on a high floor. This room was nice but some finishing touches seem to have gone awol, ie the throw from the bed etc which if we hadnt have been in another room we probably wouldnt have noticed. Beds are comfy, my other half even said its one of the best beds he's slept in?? During our short stay we found the reception staff to be ok, one girl in particular was very friendly and helpful but others didnt even acknowledge you as you came and went. Housekeeping could do with a kick up the bum, one day we came came back to the room to find no tea, coffee etc, and an empty toilet roll hadnt been replensished, the cardboard tube was still on the holder. The hotel don't (or didnt whilst we were there) provide english/breakfast tea in the rooms, only herbal and fruit. So if you like a tea in the morning, take some just in case. Coffee was provided in the room. One other thing to bear in mind is that whilst the very nearby metro station is handy, it must run under the hotel or under somewhere close because when we were in the lower floor room we could feel and hear it. So if you are a light sleeper take some earplugs or make sure you get a high floor. All in all, the hotel is in a good location, even if at first you might think it isnt and it is comfortable enough for a few nights. We would definately consider staying there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions”
Reviews.Author: mrrick200 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to a very helpful, friendly receptionist who even though we were early, like 08:30 am, had a room prepared while we had breakfast. The rooms are small (as most in Paris I understand) but clean and with a small balcony and a view of the Seine river. The same receptionist was a pleasure, advising us on tours, things to see and booking us a dinner cruise which was very nice. My wife and I were visiting Paris for sightseeing mainly while I was on my way to work in Angola, Africa for one month. We purchased food for our consumption, but also things like noodle soup and cereal for me to take to work offshore. The problem was, I believe when the maid mentioned all the food we had in our room, and assumed we were there to "camp out" in the room and eat. This was far from the truth, as we ate out every meal except for the hotel breakfasts, which were extra money but worth the 15 euros each. They removed the water container part of our coffee machine so we could not make soup with the water saying the machine was broken, although it worked fine. This was unfortunate as I had purchased my own brand of coffee that I prefer, even though theirs was free. I would have appreciated the manager speaking to us but that was not the case so carried on and enjoyed our time in Paris. The main problem was the second receptionist. She tried to overcharge us for 2 breakfasts, and commented that we had not spent much money in the hotel for staying 4 nights. That was true as we had paid for 2 days full breakfasts with the booking. The hotel does not serve lunch and diner...plus why would she care or even comment about this issue. When I was paying the bill to check out, I informed her that we had also booked a 1/2 day trip to the country, through the hotel, and paid 10 euros for the booking. When we arrived to take the tour, they had sold our seats and the tour was full. I requested the 10 euros be refunded, and she stated it was not "her" fault and she would not refund the money. We were flabergausted. The Mercure hotel is a fine chain, and I stayed at the Mercure near the Paris Airport almost every month for 5 years because of it's quality and service. It is unfortunate that a couple misguided workers can change the stay of a couple only wishing to enjoy a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: prashar18
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with my wife. The hotel staff members are very good, very helpful and suggested us various places to visit in Paris. The standard room is very small so we upgraded to premiere and I would suggest staying in a premiere as the price difference is not much. Location is excellent with short walk to Eiffel tower, metro, rer station and good restaurants. Thank you Mercure Paris Plaza Pont Mirabeau for making our stay comfortable in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay by Radhika & Ashutosh Sultania at the Hotel from 11th to 13th Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: Radhika259
Reviews.Content: The moment we checked in at the hotel, the hospitality given to us was very warm. Ms. Veronique helped us with all the information that we wanted - with regard to Paris Travel Pass, Travel by Metro and places to see. All the information was given to us. The hotel looks really smart and professional, we liked the room very much and the idea of an organic breakfast. The idea to have the bathroom separately was great and different. Thanks for the lovely time we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SHAMARC
Reviews.Content: We booking this hotel on the web and were very impressed with the photos. When we arrived we discovered that everthing was very small eg. the bedside table was approximately 6" sq! Breakfast was a bit of a disaster as there was supposed to be a hot breakfast however, during our 3 day stay there was only ever one spoonful of scrambled egg in the dish which was never topped up. One morning we arrived for breakfast to discover that not one table was set up but staff were wandering around with no sense of urgency to sort it out. On a plus, the hotel is very well located and is tastefully decorated and definitely clean. I would stay there again but now I know what to expect!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lana S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 15 min walk from the Eiffel Tower. We booked a double room and we traveled with a kid. When we came there we were told by a very nice front desk lady that we were upgraded to a priviledge room for us to have a bigger room. She told us that they just opened in February 2011 and the clients satisfaction is really important to them. The room was really clean, modern and stylish. My husband even said that he wants to have such a design at home. Staff were really friendly and helpful. We booked a nice lunch cruise with their help which is one of the best experiencies of our trip. This is the hotel I would love to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but big room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: jetsetmark
Reviews.Content: our room certainly did have the river view we asked for but it was very small. fittings and decor of a high standard. however still cant work out how it gets four stars. breakfast was basic. for example, there was supposed to be hot food but over three days there were only sausages, scrambled egg dish empty every day. dining room is just an offshoot from reception. everything is on a small scale. the bedside table is literally 6 in sq. a nice area though. wouldnt put me off staying again but not the luxury we had hoped for

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Titch040
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location, right next to the metro and approx 15min walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were spotless with very comfortable beds. The staff were very helpful, advising on travel and tours. Definately a hotel I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “an aussie in paris”
Reviews.Author: cvever Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very happy with hotel. The guy on the front desk was excellent. The room was generous, clean and comfortable. The toilet with it's own closing door was separate from the bathroom which is nice. Its close to the metro and RER so transport is no woories and its close to the peripherique so a cab fare from the airport won't be as bad as a more central hotel. Easy walk to Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Top Notch Service to Back it Up”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Eye_USA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure Paris Pont Mirabeau for four nights with my girlfriend. It was our first time ever in Paris and we needed to have a great time after all the planning and the stress involved with flying overseas to what we consider the most visited country in the world. This hotel made our stay as lovely as it could have been. It started out a little rocky. I booked our room literally 25 minutes before we showed up to check in after our original hotel fell through. I found a killer deal on Easy Click travel with the breakfast buffet included at no cost. We showed up and met Luca, one of the managers, and our confirmation flashed across his screen within a minute of us walking in the front door. While the reservation was good, a room that could accommodate two people was not available. Luca told us that if we sandwiched into a single for the night he would give us a double PRIVILEGE room for the remainder of our stay. I did not have much of a choice because it was already 9:00 p.m. and I was not about to scour the streets of a town I had never been to before in the hopes of maybe finding a hotel to take us on the fly. So I put my faith in Luca...and I am glad I did. The next afternoon, we moved into room 402 which was a very nice room with a tub and coffee maker, and with a decent view out the window. You should know that this Hotel is very modern, it only opened in Feb. of 2011. The shower and tub is very comfortable. The air conditioning made it as cold as we wanted but on several nights we slept with the windows open because there was a nice breeze, little to no street noise and some lovely flowers boxes on the guard rail. The room was cleaned each time we got back and the fridge came in very handy when we wanted to store some food or cool some beers. There is free internet on the computer in the lobby. We used it to research the Paris pass which is a phenomenal value if you plan on going to some of the museums and attractions in the city. We bought a two day pass for 35 euros a person and we made the money back within the first six hours of using it. Breakfast is the only time that we got frustrated at the Mercure. It ends at 10 a.m. but if you show up at 9:45 a.m. don't expect much. I am an American and there are plenty of rude Americans but some of the things I witnessed at the breakfast bar by some of the Europeans were pretty unspeakable. At one point, I saw a German man threaten to call his lawyer because he did not make it down in time to get some food. He was intent on suing because he could not get a bowl of granola with milk or a couple of breakfast sausages! A Spanish woman removed a hot tray from the chaffing dish and then dumped the remainder of the food onto her plate, while people were waiting in line behind her! You would think she could have left one or two morsels for others but no such luck. I later saw a French woman create a tower of rolls and croissants on her dish that stood at least 10 inches tall. It would take me five days to eat that much bread and pastry but she felt that she had to have them all. These are all savage moves and no one culture should be looked down on for these sophomoric tactics. But I just wish to warn you: the breakfast buffet turns into the school cafeteria just as it is about to run out of food. Your best bet is to get there at 9 and beat the rush and the headaches associated with watching people greedily horde food. Now onto the neighborhood, for being so close to the Eiffel Tower (20 minute walk), it actually feels like a real French neighborhood. There are great, low key restaurants nearby that don't have menus in English but will try and translate as best as possible. There is a pharmacy across the street. This came in very handy when I developed a severe head cold on my second day. There was a lovely young lady inside who helped me select a cold medicine. She spoke great English which really saved the remainder of my vacation. There is also a kebab hut and small produce market next to that if you feel like getting some snacks. The bus that took us to ORLY airport for the next leg of our trip stoped right in front of the hotel entrance. And the metro and suburb train is across the street, literally spitting distance. This comes in very handy when you want to visit the main attractions in the city or go out to Versailles to see Louie's famous palace. Aside from the wonderful location and amenities, the people working at the Mercure are very nice. I had the chance to speak with Vincent, the head manager, Kevin, and Luca on multiple occasions. Each of them, along with the petite Asian lady were all sincerely interested in making our stay as nice as possible. This is a hidden gem of a hotel and I am glad we were able to stay there when we did. Because it is a relatively young property, there is an emphasis to leave this positive and lasting impression on each guest that comes in the door. Older hotels could really care less. But the people we came into contact with are passionate about what they do and it is quite refreshing to see that kind of commitment, particularly in the hotel/hospitality industry, where horror stories are a dime a dozen. Do yourself a favor and book a room there if you want to have a great Paris experience. It you can throw the extra money in for one of their privilege rooms I would do it.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4*. Clean and modern but odd rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BaharY
Reviews.Content: Went for a 2 night stay in May 2011 and got a good deal through lastminute.com where it was a top secret hotel. Had high expectations because it is a 4* and was left a little disappointed because it is more like a standard 3*. We booked a double room but when we checked in we got given room 803 on 8th floor which was tiny and only had a three quarter size bed. You could barely walk around the bed which almost filled the whole room. I went to reception to ask if it was really a double room and we got moved to room 105 which was bigger ( with a bigger bed) but still a little odd. It had very little natural light (one window faced a walled courtyard and another was a small window high up) and although the shower room and toilet were separate which was great, the shower room didn't have a door, just a curtain. That said, both rooms were clean and modern. The location of the hotel is great for the Eiffel tower which is only 20 mins walk away along the river and there is a metro stop right outside. If you want to be in the heart of it with lots of bars, cafes and restaurants around you then this hotel probably isn't for you. All in all, I would recommend it but I just wish we had known that it isn't really like a 4* so that we could have managed our expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice brand new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_deezLondon
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed spending 2 nights in this brand new hotel in the banks of Seine in Paris. Quiet area in a quite central area of Paris (15th Arrondissement) I had a room with a funny shape, they probably had to accommodate the old building architecture! As they don’t have a proper kitchen, breakfast is simple but works fine. No Restaurant. Small bar in the hotel but would suggest to go elsewhere in Paris. Good transportation means (Javel underground/RER train station). Also you can park your car in the street nearby. This is free at night. Car parks suggested by the hotel staff are too far away and I don’t think they are worth the money if you can find a free space in the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Paris Plaza Pont Mirabeau
HotelInfo.Address: 10 avenue Emile Zola, 75015 Paris, France
